title: Layering
description: A planar foliation is defined by a tabular succession of layers > 5 mm thick. This definition is based on the proposed definition of gneiss by the NADM Science Language Technical Team.  The <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicStructure</font> characteristic of gneiss is layering.

foliationType.title: foliationType
foliationType.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">foliationType:FoliationTypeTerm</font> property specifies the type of foliation from a controlled vocabulary. Examples include crenulation cleavage, slaty cleavage and schistosity.

layerComposition.title: voidable
layerComposition.description: The layerComposition property is an association between a Layering and a RockMaterial that describes the rock material that may define compositional layering.
